meanings.definition: Marlings: plural noun - small pieces of rope used for binding or seizing
meanings.sent1: The sailor used marlings to secure the sail to the mast.
meanings.sent2: The marlings were neatly coiled on the deck of the ship.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull tried to steal the marlings for its nest.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like marlings, tightly binding everyone to her cause.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the sea was intertwined with the scent of the marlings.

meanings.definition: Marlings: verb - to bind or seize with marlings
meanings.sent1: He had to marlings the boxes together before lifting them.
meanings.sent2: The sailor expertly marlings the ropes to secure the cargo.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to marlings the audience's attention with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: She felt as if invisible chains were marlings her to the past.
meanings.sent5: The vines seemed to marlings themselves around the old tree trunk.

meanings.definition: Marlings: adjective - pertaining to or made of marlings
meanings.sent1: The marlings rope was strong and durable.
meanings.sent2: She admired the marlings knots on the sailor's uniform.
meanings.sent3: The cat curled up on the marlings blanket for a nap.
meanings.sent4: His words had a marlings quality, binding everyone in agreement.
meanings.sent5: The marlings fabric shimmered in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
